definition.definition: Any act of terrorism designed to damage the agriculture of a state, especially by destroying crops or introducing pests or diseases.
A chronic disease caused by compulsive and uncontrollable consumption of alcoholic beverages, leading to addiction and deterioration in health and social functioning.
An ideal rustic or pastoral state.
A theory that considers a work of cinema or television as the work of its director, rather than of the actors or producers.
the theory that human and animal behavior can be explained in terms of conditioning, without appeal to thoughts or feelings.
The act of eating another of one's own species.
The overwhelming desire or urge to advance one's own career or social status, usually at the expense of other personal interests, social growth, or ethics.
A style based on slavish imitation, without character or originality.
belief in the existence of a supreme being, specifically of a creator who does not intervene in the universe.
An inclination to escape from routine or reality into fantasy.
a mild or indirect word or expression substituted for one considered to be too harsh or blunt when referring to something unpleasant or embarrassing.
a form of sexual behavior in which gratification is strongly linked to a particular object or activity or a part of the body other than the sexual organs.
Strict adherence to a given form of conduct, practice etc.
The belief that all human activity is futile.
The quality or state of being gigantic; being of abnormally large size.
A general devotion to the pursuit of pleasure.
The property of a person of having high ideals that are usually unrealizable or at odds with practical life.
an artist's expression of emotion in an imaginative and beautiful way.
The (often sexual) enjoyment of receiving pain or humiliation.
Constant concern over material possessions and wealth; a great or excessive regard for worldly concerns.
a system of parts working together in a machine; a piece of machinery.
The belief in a single deity (one god or goddess); especially within an organized religion.
